{{Wireless embedded system |brand=ADB |model=DV 2211 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=04/19/2013 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=DareGlobal |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router,dsl modem |fcc_id=RS3DV2211 |ic_id= |us_id=SDIDL01BDV2211 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM63168 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand= |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=2 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM63168 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |addl_chips= |flags=VDSL2 |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= }} ''Wi-Fi 11n VDSL2 Gateway with ADSL2+ Fallback''
[http://www.adbglobal.com/broadband/northamericasbloglayout/dv2211.html Product page]
[http://www.adbglobal.com/medias/images/products/DV_2211/adb_dv2211_us_datasheet.pdf Datasheet] :It appears one Ethernet port can be assigned as LAN port, if desired. This device is using a single-chip WiSoC.. which is not identifiable in the terrible quality FCC photos. Looking at the FCC manual, the device is presumed to be '''Broadcom''' based... and per the below data, it is using BCM63168 (BCM63168U?). ==Info dumped from a sample device== ADB# show version SoftwareVersion: DV2211_USA_3.1.2.0002 HardwareVersion: BCM63168 Manufacturer: ADB Broadband ModelName: DV2211
